description:
A good sized room with a comfy double bed and views across Bristol. Wander to the local park in the morning, pop to the harbourside to explore for the day and head to the local in the evening!

The space
The room is in an old Victorian house and has views across Bristol to the famous Suspension Bridge. This looks fantastic at night with all the lights.

The bathroom has a bath only (there is a shower attachment but it is not very powerful), but there is lots of hot water and bubble bath. There is a table and chair in the room as well as hanging space.

The house is very homely; it's more very relaxed and shabby chic than perfection. There a quite a few walk books for the area that you are welcome to borrow.

I live in the house and may well be there when you stay. I am away a lot of weekends, but generally there in the weeks.

description:
A small double room in an artist's house, with North Street indy culture, bars and shops on the doorstep. Nestled on a quiet street just next to the action. Enjoy breakfast in the garden. 17 minutes' walk from the centre of Bristol / 2 minutes from the bus stop.

The space
Private room in a characterful cottage / artist studio. Great central location.

I work as an artist/designer, and the house is full of interesting and beautiful things I've collected from the UK and travels in South America and Asia.

The White Room has a small double bed and an airbed, it can accommodate 1 or 2 people.

There is on-street parking nearby and a free carpark; unrestricted at weekends.

Guest access
Fully equipped kitchen & bathroom.
Living Room.
Dining room most of the time.
Front & back gardens.

description:
A room with a shared bathroom in a Victorian terraced house - expect creaky floorboards and doors.

I work from home so ask that you're out during working hours as my office is next to the spare room.

description:
The space
This is a sunny, light high ceilinged apartment on the garden level of this impressive Grade 2 listed 200 year old Georgian house set on a hill in Montpelier, Bristol. The owner lives on the top 2 levels of the property. The apartment has its own side door at the bottom of the side steps (with iron handrail) with access to a south facing terrace overlooking the garden. The terrace is for sole use of the apartment and access
to the garden is allowed if there are children staying (there is a 2 metre drop down to the vegetable patch at the end of the garden so young ones will need to be supervised for safety)
This is ideal for 2 people but there is a new full size double super comfy sofa bed (a proper thick mattress 140cm X 190cm) in the living room which has a really comfy thick mattress on it and has had excellent feedback for comfort (available for £20 per person per night). There is also a new solid fold out bed. There is a large travel cot available

The Barn has a "retro/rustic/bunk house character" with exposed beams some dating from the Napoleonic Wars. The kitchen area in the main room comprises an electric cooker, butler's sink, microwave, refrigerator with small freezer section, kettle and toaster, utensils and crockery. Complimentary beverages, breakfast cereals, eggs mostly from our own hens, homemade bread, jam and cake, milk and bacon are provided to kick start your stay. There is a full size table tennis table and bar football for the young at heart! description:
This bright and cheerful flat is ideal for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers. A hall floor flat in a large Victorian property located between Gloucester Road and Whiteladies Road and within easy walking distance of the city centre. It's a very peaceful neighbourhood and the flat has huge sash windows with original wooden shutters and a comfy king size bed to help ensure a good night's sleep.

The space
My flat is located in a wonderfully leafy area that's only a short walk from some of Bristol's best bits. I hope you will find the space as comfortable and homely as I do, and that you'll love exploring this vibrant city.

Check-in may be possible earlier than 5pm, depending on the date- please message me to enquire.

description:
Visually attractive and tactile three-bedroom house with sofa bed in sitting room; Mandy's and my UK home, but we spend more of our time in the south of France these days. Whilst many Airbnb properties are exclusively commercial, this is our home and we take care to host people we believe will treat it with respect. We welcome guests from all different walks of life and countries, the more diverse the better! We would love to host you; please contact us with any questions you may have!

The space

description:
An old shop packed full of character, up a hill in a peaceful location a couple of minutes from vibrant cultural hub of Stokes Croft.

A light and comfortable double room in a house that's distinctive and full of life, in what I reckon must be the most charming street in the area (if not the city!)

There's a colourful bathroom with a great walk-in shower and comfortable bath. Fresh towels and bedding, of course.

It's fine to use the kitchen to prepare food and cook, and also to hang out in the living space (and play any instruments if you're that way inclined), and the terrace is accessible anytime. It's lovely up there day or night!

If you want to cook in my kitchen that's ok as long as you clean up!!

It's just a hop, skip and jump over the Suspension Bridge to Ashton Court. Just down the road are amazing views over the Avon Gorge, and 10mins the other way is Bristol City Centre, easily reachable by bus or walking. You'll love the local scene and no doubt Bristol as well. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, and business travellers.

The space
It's a basement flat of one of the most iconic terraces in Bristol. You'll have your own entrance. I've lived here for a year and it's in the best location... you can easily get to the independent shops and cute cafes in Clifton Village, or you can sit on the hill and watch the balloons go over the Clifton Suspension bridge. description:
A super cool apartment that is a Grade II Bank conversion in central Bristol. Close to bars, restaurants, shopping, Museums. The price is higher, against other apartments in the area due to the vast size and quality. The perfect place to explore Bristol Old City. St Nicholas Market 2 - mins. walk. Recently used on BBC Poldark and BBC Drama

My place is close to parks, art and culture, and restaurants and dining. You’ll love my place because of the location, the ambiance, and the people.

The space
A grade II listed bank in the heart of Bristol Old City. Located in a desirable location on Broad street, one of the Old Cities most ornate streets.

As seen on the ITV Lorraine Show!

The apartment is ground level and still has an original bank vault door, dating back to the 18th century. The bank vault is now the bathroom, with a secret room!

The total space is 80 SQM2 so much larger than any standard hotel bedroom.

Guest access

A home away from home. So I hope you have a great experience and enjoy!!

description:
My home is in a quiet cul de sac, moments away from the vibrant Gloucester Road with independent shops, cafes and charity shops, there's something for everyone. I have two listings to choose from, Queensize bedroom, bathroom with bath, or small double bedroom and shower room on the top floor. If you want two rooms that's fine too, you pay per room. Downstairs is open plan with lovely light sitting, dining room and kitchen looking onto the garden. Underfloor heating makes it feel nice and cosy.

The space
I have a newly built three storey house which fits perfectly within the mainly Victorian houses in the street. It has a toilet on the ground floor as well as bathrooms on each floor, discounting my own. The downstairs open plan is lovely and light and also has a cosy feel. I have a few nice and precious to me pieces of furniture, I would appreciate if they are respected. The french and bifold doors in the ground floor look out onto a pretty little garden.

description:
My home is in a quiet cul de sac, moments away from the vibrant Gloucester Road with independent shops, cafes and charity shops, there's something for everyone. I have two listings to choose from, Queensize bedroom, bathroom with bath, or Small Double bedroom and shower room on the top floor. If you want two rooms that's fine too, you pay per room. Downstairs is open plan with lovely light sitting, dining room and kitchen looking onto the garden. Underfloor heating makes it feel nice and cosy.

The space
I have a newly built three storey house which fits perfectly within the mainly Victorian houses in the street. It has a toilet on the ground floor as well as bathrooms on each floor, discounting my own. The downstairs open plan is lovely and light and also has a cosy feel. I have a few nice and precious to me pieces of furniture, I would appreciate if they are respected. The french and bifold doors in the ground floor look out onto a pretty little garden.

description:
The flat is at the end of a very quiet Mews, and guests can use the parking space directly outside. The flat has its own entrance up a flight of steps. The bedroom has a standard double bed, TV, wifi, tea and coffee making facilities and filtered water. The bathroom is next door and is shared with just myself.
Breakfast cereals are provided, and please let me know if you have any dietary requests. Also, there is an infared sauna in the room, which guests can use for an extra £8 for 30 mins.

The space
The space is quiet, with off street parking and the use of an infared sauna ( for a small charge).
It's within a 15min walk of Southmead Hospital. And also a very short drive to Airbus, Rolls Royce and MOD. There is bus stop outside the Mews that will take you to Cribs Causeway, or into the centre of Bristol. It's about a 15 mins bus ride to Whiteladies Rd and 25 mins to the centre. Henleaze Rd shops and Westbury Village are also very close.

description:
The old barn at Trymwood sits at the side of the Grade 2 listed house in the historic village of Westbury on Trym just 3 miles from the centre of Bristol. The barn was originally part of the farm buildings, later becoming a scullery for the main house, and evidence of the old range and bread oven are still in place as is the meat salting sink. Inside much of the cottage character remains. There is a wonderful large garden for guests to enjoy and children to explore

The space
Also best for 4 adults with an option of 2 more using the sofa bed

Guest access
The Old Barn is a self contained cottage which is attached to the main house. It has separate access at the front and at the rear. The garden is a shared space.

description:
The house is an old stone cottage, built right on top of the escarpment 200 metres above Bristol with a fantastic, panoramic view over the city. The house is decorated in a contemporary style with light, bright rooms. There is a great, green-oak, double height conservatory which we use as a dining room that faces towards the view.

The house is 15 minutes drive from Bristol and about 8 from the airport.

During the balloon festival there is a spectacular view of the balloons over the city.

The space
There are 2 double rooms and one with an emperor sized bed.. There is a family bathroom upstairs. The downstairs sitting room is split level and opens onto the dining room. There is a separate kitchen with downstairs cloakroom and utility space beyond it.

In summer the garden has a terrace and is a lovely place to eat lunch outside.

Guest access
The entire house will be at your disposal during your stay.

description:
An old shop packed full of character, up a hill in a peaceful location a couple of minutes from vibrant cultural hub of Stokes Croft.
With stunning city views from the roof terrace which has easy access via a staircase and sky hatch.

The space
There's a big open lounge area with a big dining table that will seat 8 people comfortably and a wood burning stove. It's fine to use anything in the kitchen to cook and use the washing machine and other appliances.

The upper staircase leading to the roof terrace has a sky hatch that is opened by a hydraulic motor, and operated via a switch on the wall. You just need to open it fully and walk out. It's lovely up there day and night!

Guest access
Guests have use of the whole house.
There's a a back yard off the kitchen and the roof terrace is good to use at any time ( I only ask that the roof hatch is not left open in case of rain)

description:
Single room available in Victorian terraced home in south Bristol. A fifteen minute walk from Temple Meads railway station, three minutes to Victoria Park and fifteen minutes to Bristol city centre. Our cosy rustic Victorian cottage situated on Clouds Hill Road close to St George's Park, local corner shops with excellent bus link into city center.

This is our home, we just rent it out when we are away. It is clean & comfortable and comes with an adorable cat.

Living room has original gas fireplace, cosy seating, lots of books - comfortably seats 4 people.

description:
My stylish modern flat is situated behind the popular St Andrews Park, and just a short walk from Gloucester Road, a hub of independent shops, restaurants and bars.

The apartment has been recently refurbished to a high standard and is set over two floors with a spacious open-plan living area, and a comfortable bedroom.

It also benefits from a lovely little garden to the rear.

The space
The full apartment includes a spacious and bright living/dining space with a fully-equipped kitchen and bathroom at the ground floor whereas the double bedroom is located upstairs.
The flat is electrically heated, in addition to the double bed there's a sofa-bed in the living space, which allow up to 3 people in the flat.
Dark brown refurbished wooden planks covers the lower floor whereas a new fluffy carpet covers stairs and the bedroom floor.
When you enter the flat you will find fresh and clean bed sets and towels for all the guests.

description:
Bright Grade II listed lower ground apartment in the heart of Clifton. A few minutes walk from the famous Park Street, ‘the triangle' and the city centre. Easy access to restaurants, amenities and attractions: theatres, cinema, museum, Cabot Circus, University, Clifton Suspension Bridge, the Downs, and docks. A great base to enjoy the beautiful city of Bristol!
The flat is well equipped with a newly furnished kitchen including induction hob, oven and fridge freezer. It has a Smart TV and WIFI.

The space
Situated in a grade 2 Regency building in Clifton. The flat has many original features from 1843; as you walk into the original arched under croft/vaults you will notice the original brazier and washing facilities of the property. The bedroom has a newly uncovered lovely fireplace and shutters. The under croft is the access point to the flat and is very secure with a large storage space for buggies or bikes or suitcases!

description:
First floor flat: private entrance, sensitively restored to authentic details, wooden floors throughout: two bedrooms (one double, one single galley style) living room, wood burning stove, hallway (views of Clifton suspension bridge), spacious kitchen with skylights, bathroom. Furnished. Quiet, calm, arty, plenty of books. A fifteen minute walk from Temple Meads station, three minutes to Victoria Park and a fifteen minute walk to Bristol city centre or the North Street area. Sole Use.

The space
The flat is characterful and restored with bo-ho style creative furnishings, French 'club', reclaimed, living room chairs, and includes innumerable books (the owner is a writer), Wifi, but no TV. It is ideal for those seeking an authentic, artistic and relaxed home environment from which to explore Bristol. Garden. Off street parking sometimes available. Plenty of free residential parking.

description:
We are located in St Pauls, central Bristol, yards from the independent and creative heart of Stokes Croft which is packed with cafes, bars, restaurants and is the thriving base of the city’s counter culture. Our home is a quiet haven from all of this and is a friendly, easy going space. I live here with my young son and cat. We have busy lives and are mainly out and about. As with all little people...we need quiet around bedtime and there can be some bustle in the mornings too from around 7 am.

The space
Our home is a light filled Georgian maisonette and you can see from the pictures that it is a colourful and homely space. We are primarily a family home and though I like to keep it ship shape for guests, my son does like to empty his lego on the floor! However, we are friendly and easy going and like to welcome similar people to our home. The bedroom and bathroom are on the second floor of the house, accessed via stairs.

A few mins walk from vibrant North Street, with its independent shops, cafes & bars. Also in easy reach of Ashton Court, Ashton Gate, Harbourside & the centre.

Frequent bus routes to Temple Meads & airport. Free on street parking.

The space
Set in a quiet residential street you'll feel at home while being in easy reach of town.

Guests have full use of the kitchen, lounge, dining room and bathroom.

description:
Private downstairs flat with shared entrance.
Wonderful SW facing private terrace with views over River Avon.
Walk along river to Nature Reserve (8 mins) or Bristol City Centre (50 mins).
Range of cafes, restaurants & pubs within 20 min walk or 5 minute drive.
Double bed with en suite shower room.
Living room, breakfast table & Freesat TV.
Tea, coffee, fridge, microwave & toaster.
10 min taxi from Temple Meads train station.
Free off-road parking.
Beautifully quiet location beside River Avon.

The space
The private terrace is a wonderful place to sit for an early morning coffee or an evening drink. Soak up the sun throughout the afternoon and look out for the rowers, swans, ducks and wildlife. A brand new private en suite shower room was added in February 2020.

description:
Modern, spacious, private and quiet house in the heart of Bristol, with loads of natural light and large open spaces. Off street parking with lovely garden set up for great outdoor living. Underfloor heating with gas fireplace for cosy winter nights and days. Easy walking to many of Bristols attractions, not least Gloucester Road, really on the doorstep! There is a friendly cat in residence who is no trouble at all, she just needs a feed each day..

The space
With one of Bristols best village streets on the doorstep the house is remarkably secluded and protected from the hustle and bustle of the world outside. Completely enclosed property and very private, the house offers large space both indoor and outdoor to relax, unwind and reboot for the next day.

Guest access
Full access to the property except the garage.

Other things to note
Friendly cat that lives on the property; all food will be included

description:
Welcome to our Victorian family home in relaxing Bishopston, near Gloucester Road, the best shopping street in the UK for independent shops, cafes, pubs, restaurants and artisan bakeries. 20 mins by bus to the centre and 20 mins walking to the entertainment district of Stokes Croft. At the end of the street is one of Bristol's loveliest parks, St Andrews Park, with a designated play area and paddling pool. The Times Newspaper rated Bishopston as the best area of Bristol.

The space
This is a spacious, characterful house that families and groups really enjoy and find relaxing as it's our family house. In good weather there's the garden and patio while the sun room is also our dining room and works whatever the weather! The bedrooms can be configured in a number of ways for beds and in the loft, the two single beds can be pushed together to make a double. We really want you to enjoy our house as your home during your stay.

Great location in Clifton. Ideal for anyone visiting Bristol for work or pleasure. Easy access to city centre on the main bus route and Clifton Down railway station nearby.

The space
Quiet and private en-suite room available in this 2 bed ground floor apartment in a beautiful Grade II listed Clifton Terrace. The bedroom is situated at the rear of the property and away from any traffic noise and is accessed from the kitchen. This cosy bedroom has a king size bed with bedside tables, chest of drawers and wardrobe with hanging space. The room also comes with its own bright, modern en-suite bathroom with shower cubicle, toilet and washbasin. Towels and linen are provided and hairdryer in room. This is a Pet and Smoke Free house and free wifi available. Tea or coffee will be available.

15 minute drive from Bristol airport

description:
Our 200 year old family home is a beautiful Georgian house with original features in the heart of Montpelier in Bristol. The house is full of art, plants and books and has a wild garden full of fruit trees. Montpelier is Bristol's bohemian area famous for it's street art. We're a 5 minute walk away from two excellent restaurants - Bianci's Italian and Thali Cafe and a 10-15 minute walk to Bristol city centre. We have old thin walls so for noise reasons this house is only suitable for families.

The space
There are original fires that work in the TV room & master bedroom and we can leave smokeless fuel if you request this. The dining area seats 8-10 on benches and there are 2 additional wooden chairs if needed . In the garden there’s a bbq, outdoor seating, kid’s swing, pond and trees to climb. The area is very peaceful at night !

Guest access
The entire house.

description:
Our basement studio flat is located in the heart of picturesque Clifton Village very close to the famous Clifton Suspension Bridge. Thoughtfully decorated in a contemporary style, our studio is a perfect base for both business and leisure travellers alike. The bridge is almost within sight, and Bristol Zoo is around 10 minutes' walk away. Bristol is a fantastic city and we'd love to host you during your visit. We hope to welcome you to our flat soon!

The space
Our basement flat is located below our family home in beautiful Clifton. You have your own separate entrance opening into the living room/ kitchen. The open plan living area leads into the bedroom area with a double bed, with the bathroom with shower over the bath is just off of the hallway. The flat is opposite a delightful green park and has a friendly pub next door.

Access is via a key box.

description:
Welcome to my home- a Victorian terrace in a quiet residential area which is close to the city centre. You will have a large, comfortable room with the usual amenities (tea and coffee facilities, hairdryer, towels, Wifi) You will have sole use of the downstairs shower room which also has a small washbasin and a toilet. I will provide breakfast for you to enjoy in your room.
The room is on the ground floor so you have privacy. Your own key gives you the flexibility to come and go.
Welcome!

The space
The house is light and airy-sun streams into your room in the afternoon.
The room has a table and chairs in the bay window and a comfortable double bed. I also have a 'put-up' bed to accommodate one extra person if necessary, at a small extra charge.

In the morning, for breakfast, there is cereal, home-made bread with jam or marmalade and fresh fruit.
I provide tea, coffee, hot chocolate and herb teas (also plant-based milk and spread)

Ideal as a base for a weddings. Come and relax in a spacious home.

It's a really cosy but large open plan contemporary home, spacious with large communal areas, outside as well as inside. The driveway provides ample parking for 4 cars.

Our beautiful 7 metre yurt is set in a private acre of woodland, meadow and ponds in the heart of St Werburghs. With views of the allotments and bordered by a nature reserve, you’d never know you’re so close to the city centre.

The space
In the yurt are a double sofa bed, a double mattress and a sofa bed that can be arranged as a double or a single. There are also two tables with chairs and bookcases with books, toys and games. There’s a gas heater and a stove for boiling water.

Outside is a compost loo and a large covered seating area next to a meadow. Wandering around you’ll find ponds, hammocks and many unusual plants. There’s also a zip line, a swing and a slide.

Guest access
Guests have exclusive use of the yurt. There's no kitchen or bathroom but there’s a compost loo in the meadow and a small stove for boiling water in the yurt.

description:
Beautiful newly decorated 2 bedroom flat - comfortable furniture and all the bits and bobs you need for your stay. Located in the heart of Bristol, bang in the middle of the popular and vibrant Gloucester Road, you will be spoilt for choices of places to eat, drink, shop and soak up the unique culture of Bristol. Should you wish to explore, Gloucester Road has excellent transport links, making it the perfect base from which to discover this stunning and historic region of the UK.

The space
The flat is newly refurbished, bright and attractive. The kitchen is fully-equipped (incl. coffee machine) and opens onto an attractive living space. I think the pictures say it all really and as you will see the house is kitted out with all the extras and luxuries to please everyone.

Guest access
Guests have access to all of the property except a separate driveway that is fenced off as this is a commercial area.

Other things to note
The property is situated in a residential area and is not suitable for groups that want to play loud music or make large amounts of noise. It is for relaxing quite trips only so please only book of this is your intention....

All Outside areas are covered by CCTV. Please

Our large open plan kitchen, dining & family room with bi-folding doors open on to our large sunny garden giving you plenty of space to kick back & relax in after exploring this wondrous City. There are 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a cosy sitting room and free street parking

The space
Our family home is located over 3 floors. There is a cosy sitting room at the front of the house and a spacious, light & airy open plan kitchen and dining/family room at the rear with bi-folding doors opening up into our large sunny garden which is on 2 levels enabling you to enjoy the sun all day. description:
A great space to come back to while exploring Bristol and the surrounding area. Our lovingly restored Flat in a Georgian building is on a quiet street just a stones throw from Gloucester Road and the bustling heart of Stokes Croft.

Free on-street parking is available or alternatively Bristol bus station and Temple leads train station are nearby.

The space
Our flat has been thoughtfully designed to create a relaxing space within a city centre location.

Our flat is on the basement floor of one of Bristol’s traditional Georgian houses and so includes a beautiful courtyard. You are more than welcome to relax, bbq, and have your morning coffee or an anytime glass of wine in our little sun trap!

There is also a covered bench nook to sit in no matter what the weather. We recommend this as an excellent spot to settle in with a book! Historically it would have been used as a coal store for the house, but is now a cosy little spot for rest

Double bedroom with lovely view in recently refurbed modern, super clean, quiet house in leafy village close to Bristol town centre. Cul de sac location with great transport links in & out of Bristol and close to motorways, great for commuting if you want to be somewhere quiet but with easy access to the action. Local high street & public transport within a few mins walk.

There is a resident cat and a supply of antihistamines if needed!

Bedroom is a good size double with comfy mattress and bedding, wardrobe and drawers, black out blind & curtains. I have towels and toiletries available if needed. Upstairs bathroom has a bath plus shower, basin and toilet.

description:
Beautiful bright clean double room, in a creative house, near central Bristol.

The space
Wonderful victorian house, very close to the ever popular Church Road/St Georges Park and 15 mins bus ride into town. This is a two bedroom house and you will be sharing with me the owner and two friendly cats that tend to keep themselves to themselves and are very sweet.The house is colourful and creative, your room light and airy, the bed comfy with Organic cotton sheets and Turkish towels. The house is wonderfully positioned close to the city, but also very close to a nature reserve and a beautiful river, where you will find great pubs and sunny spots to chill if you so wish.

You are also welcome to use the kitchen and feel free to help yourself to tea and coffee & the garden.

I'm happy to chat and socialise if around or give you privacy if you need.

The is free on street parking if you drive and great transport links if you dont.

Set in a quiet location away from traffic noise, it's just out of the city buzz, but a 30 min walk or a short bus ride to the centre. A shared kitchen may also be available during your stay.

description:
Just four minutes walk from Clifton Village's independent shops, restaurants, cafes and bars. A 20 minute walk along the historic Harbourside brings you to the city centre. Our private, semi-basement flat is light and airy, impeccably appointed, quiet & comfortable, with generously sized rooms and a beautiful courtyard garden exclusive to the flat, perfect for outdoor dining. One bedroom, a well-equipped kitchen-diner, wet room shower, sofa bed for 2 extra guests. Free on-street parking.

The space
Aa light and airy semi-basement self contained flat in our beautiful Grade 2* listed Georgian house which dates from 1846. It has has been recently updated with a modern, fresh decor.

The flat is deep cleaned and sanitised to the highest possible standards between every booking, and mid-stay for longer bookings.

We have set check in to 4.00pm and check out to 10.00 am so that we have enough time to deep clean when we have a same-day turnaround.

description:
Lovely spaciouse room in friendly famliy home, queen size bed, 32'' TV, mini fridge, microwave with grill, kettle and toaster. You are able to park right outside my home as there are no parking restrictions.
Easily accessible from both the M4 and M5 motorways, convenient location. Business travelers will appreciate our close proximity to the Aztec Business Park, Airbus & Rolls-Royce, home to many corporate clients.

Shoes are strictly NOT allowed in the room, as you need to leave it in the rack provided next to door. Taking shoes in and keeping on the carpet also NOT acceptable. IF YOU HAVE HABIT WALKING UP STAIRS WITH YOUR SHOES ON THEN MY HOUSE IS NOT SUITABLE FOR YOU.

access to whole house, private driveway & garden

The bathroom has a all glass shower cubicle.

Stylish self-contained studio with great links to the centre of Bristol; by bus or the beautiful Bristol-Bath cycle path, both are just a couple of hundred metres away. Situated in one of the most artistic and proudly independent areas of Bristol, close to both the centre and the beautiful surrounding countryside. This is a quirky room in the basement of our house on the historic christmas steps in central Bristol. description:
Sandwiched between the vibrant North Street strip & the exciting new Whapping Wharf quarter, you're surrounded by great bars, cafes, restaurants, theatres, shops, boutiques, and beckoning parks. It's the perfect spot for experiencing all that Bristol has to offer. The flat is recently renovated & accommodates up to 4 guests. We love it here & think you will too!

The space
We are absolutely in love with our flat. The space, the location, the lighting, the airiness, the outdoor area, the park, everything (without fail, my fiancee says she loves it at least once a day).

description:
Welcome to our historic tower in central Bristol where you will feel perfectly at home and experience the city as a local, in style.

The space
A spectacular Grade II listed converted church tower right in the centre of Bristol offering 3 spacious double bedrooms across 6 floors - plus two reserved parking spaces and a fantastic roof terrace. Naturally, a 6-storey bell tower comes with a lot of stairs, but it's all worth it when you reach the roof terrace and see the views over the city.

The Tower is just a 5-minute walk from Cabot Circus/Castle Park and a 10-minute walk from Temple Meads train station. The Tower is in the buzzing Old Market Quarter in Bristol centre, named by the Sunday Times as one of the coolest neighbourhoods in the UK.

The space

description:
A beautifully presented 1 bedroom apartment situated on the historic Portland Square. One of the most desirable spots in Bristol, walking distance from restaurants, bars, cafes & shops in Cabot Circus, Gloucester Rd, and Bristol's artistic quarter, Stokes Croft. Castle Park and the Harbour are also a short stroll away.

Guests: Up to 2
Benefits:
- Parking available
- Self-check-in.
- City Central – Walk to Cabot Circus in 1 minute.
- Early check-in/bag drop off available.

The space
The living area consists of a large open plan space with a fully equipped kitchen, 4-seater dining table, and lounge area. Relax in the lounge area complete with a large sofa and 32-inch smart tv. Enjoy the freedom of a fully equipped kitchen, complete with hob, fridge, freezer and toaster, along with a full range of utensils, crockery, and cutlery. Superfast WIFI comes as standard.

Bedroom
There is a king bed dressed in crisp linen.

description:
SUITABLE FOR 9AM - 5PM WORKERS.

As I work from home full time, all guests must leave before 8am each day and return after 5pm.

My flat is located on the 3rd floor with NO LIFT, the spare bathroom is adjacent to the room (not connected).

The check-in time is from 5.15pm and check-out by 8.30am.

Please enquire if you need different times prior to booking, any late check outs will result in additional fees.

Any questions, please ask😊

Guest access
The flat is located on the top floor and there is no lift, so the flat might not be suitable for guests where stairs are a problem.

Other things to note
We ask that people treat our home and neighbours with respect, no parties and no smoking inside please.

description:
Hillside Stables is a separate annexed building, to the main house, a hidden period gem with spectacular gardens. This Grade II listed home and family house, dates back to 1715 with some extensions c.1820. The owners have recently renovated the separate old stables building to build a mezzanine king-sized bed deck and shower room in this completely separate private annex with its own entrance.

The space
The Stables overlook the large and established formal gardens in circa 0.402 of an acre, as well as a beautiful yew tree believed to be c.500-600 years old, among others.

The Old Stables is a modern renovation of the home's stables that are believed to pre-war time, have hosted groomsmen and their horses, when they visited the neighbouring local hostelery, the Post Office Tavern. When prisoners were being transported across the country, they were housed in the small jail across the road, which you can still see across from our gate today.

All of our apartments have been made to an amazing standard, and you can see how lovely and bright they look. This is great for that homely feel after a long day at work.

Our apartments are in a block with other apartments which we manage. It is lovely and spacious with the warming pink style throughout the apartment.

Stylish two bedroom penthouse in Clifton with Kingsize beds & a stunning and large roof terrace boasting incredible views of the city. Central, convenient on a quiet, leafy street. 10-15 mins walk from the centre.

Seconds away from shops and supermarkets, and a short walk from the Clifton Triangle. We are also minutes from a host of award winning bars & cafes in Clifton Village & Cotham Hill. A short taxi ride from the train station.

Beautiful views in a stunning bright modern flat with sunny roof terrace and beautiful views over Clifton and to the Downs. Both rooms have super comfy beds. The en suite bedroom has a super king and the second bedroom has a king. Parking permits avaiaible to purchase.

Guest access
Entire top floor flat.
There's a flight of stairs up to the main door of the building and then four shorter flights of stairs up to the flat.

description:
A spectacular apartment in Filton, one of our most elegantly decorated and spacious properties, this is the ideal place to unwind.

This apartment is close to the MOD, UWE, Rolls Royce and Airbus. So if you are here for work, then this is a great location. With the added bonus of two parking spaces in the car park as well.

Our wonderful apartments are full of luxury, and are new in the area! There is parking with your flat, your own key safe code to get into your apartment and lovely comfy beds to have a relaxing night's sleep.

The Cabot Mews apartments are close to many amenities, approx 4 minute drive to Southmead Hospital, 10 minutes to Cribbs Causeway and easy access to get to the M32.

If you are staying for a night or more, we are here to help!

This apartment is close to the MOD, UWE, Rolls Royce and Airbus. So if you are here for work, then this is a great location. With the added bonus of two parking spaces in the car park as well.

The space
Our wonderful apartments are full of luxury! There is parking with your flat, your own key safe code to get into your apartment and lovely comfy beds to have a relaxing night's sleep. The Cabot Mews apartments are close to many amenities, approx 4 minute drive to Southmead Hospital, 10 minutes to Cribbs Causeway and easy access to get to the M32.

If you are staying for a night or more, we are here to help!

description:
Lovely, quiet room in my Edwardian house in Upper Knowle. Freshly decorated, with new double glazed sash window overlooking quiet gardens to the rear of the house, this guest room has a small (4') double bed with orthopaedic mattress, a desk and chair, clothes rail and a large, new beanbag for chilling!

The space
The house is a stylish and comfortable space, and Somerset Road is a lovely, friendly and quiet family neighbourhood. A large open plan living room/dining room with comfy chairs and sofa, leads into a large and well appointed double kitchen/ breakfast room, with large French farmhouse oak table, and equipped with a washing machine, dishwasher, new built-in fridge/freezer, oven, gas hob, large, new microwave, and all the usual amenities, which guests are welcome to use. A shelf in both fridge and freezer is set aside for your use.

description:
20 Minutes walk from the city centre.
10 minutes on the bus- ALL BUSES go to the centre from bus stop round the corner from my house.
1 Double room - 3 bed house.
Easton has cafe's, shops and good pubs, ( 5 min walk from my house, ask me to point you in the right direction).
The walk into town is easy, convenient and there is also a train station nearby that drops you off at other parts of the city - super cheap £1.50 a ticket
Myself and my daughter(half the time) live in the house.

The space
Light and stylish room in a peaceful and relaxed home.
Close to city centre, easy links to wherever you want to go in the city.

Guest access
Guests are welcome to use all facilities and spaces, except downstairs loo.

description:
The house has a feeling of home from the minute you walk through the door, a big garden with an amazing city view of Bristol.

This is a private room in house shared with a couple who work in the charity and the entertainment sector.

The space
The room has a double bed, a desk, high speed internet, drawers, shelves and a hairdryer.

The shared bathroom has a large bath and a big shower.

You are welcome to use the kitchen and dining room to cook meals. There is a dishwasher and plenty of utensils.

Feel free to play table tennis or relax in the garden.

Any questions feel free to ask.

Guest access
There is plenty of parking available on the street. The bus number 24 or 5 runs closeby or you can order an Uber to get around the city.

Other things to note
Please do not smoke in the house - you can smoke anywhere in the garden.

description:
Our beautiful Clifton flat is situated in a gorgeous period building, with original windows and lovely spacious rooms. You'll be perfectly placed to explore all the delights that Clifton Village has to offer, and with the flat located on a quiet residential street, you'll be able to get a peaceful night's sleep after busy days out!

The space
My 2 double bedroom top floor flat is conveniently located just off Whitleladies Road in Clifton, with its vast array of restaurants, bars, cafes and shops. It is just minutes away from the BRI, BBC, Bristol University, Clifton Lido & Triangle and Park Street. It is a 10 minute downhill walk into the City Centre and 10 minute drive from Temple Meads train station; you will be perfectly placed to enjoy this amazing city whether visiting for business or pleasure.

Available for weekend breaks or Monday to Friday lets both short and longer term.

description:
Mark and Corinne welcome you to Cumberland Road in Bristol’s historic harbour area.

This four bedroom semi detached Victorian house is on Spike Island, with the harbour to one side and the river the other.

The house is on four floors with big rooms and high ceilings. The garden looks over the harbour and also features a cabin with a double sofa bed.

Here you are just a few minutes’ walk from Bristol’s trendiest new quarter, Wapping Wharf - with two of the city’s highest rated restaurants.

The space
Semi detached house on four stories.

You will be able to access all rooms, including the garden and cabin.

With the harbour on one side and the River Avon New Cut the other, you’d hardly believe you’re in a city centre.

The shops, cafes and restaurants at Wapping Wharf’s award-winning Cargo are just five minutes walk away. The city centre is 10 minutes walk.

Guest access
All rooms

description:
Welcome to The Green room, it's the perfect place to explore what might just be the Uk's coolest city. In a quiet side street in the East Clifton conservation area, you'll be in the heart of it all and at the same time feel a sense of space and closeness to nature, with the Downs nearby.
The accommodation is on the ground floor of our 3 storey, 1870 home. Imperfectly quirky, cosy and welcoming, we hope the green room will make you smile.

The space
Arriving through the shared entrance hall, you'll find the green room suite, on the ground floor, aranged over 3 levels (with a shallow step between each). This part of the building used to be a shop so there's more than the usual amount of space!
You can be cosy in the alcove double bed which has charging points and dimmable lights on either side, or relax in the spacious sitting area with a large sofa which converts to a (nearly) kingsize bed. There's also a table and two chairs (more available if needed)

description:
A Victorian era building which was sympathetically converted into modern apartments approximately ten years ago. Its located in a quiet corner of St George.

The room is bright and has views of the local park. It has it's own en suite bathroom. The main bathroom is fitted with a bath / shower.

The apartment is shared with myself: you have access to the master bedroom and en suite and shared access of the lounge and kitchen

Guests can access the apartment using the key safe.

The space
The first floor flat overlooks a large green and a large cherry tree which blossoms in white during spring.
There is a wide array of wildlife, squirrels and birds can be seen in the trees from the open plan lounge and a variety of aquatic birds gather at the lake in the park which is a short walk away. The large stone walls provide excellent insulation and the brand new Combination Boiler heats the hot water and the radiators in the property effic

description:
Our comfy and spacious flat is in a Grade II listed building, historically known as the Chapel of the Three Kings of Cologne. The church was since remodelled into flats, so this beautiful original courtyard is set right in the heart of the centre of Bristol!

The space
This tucked-away hidden gem is complete with high ceilings and beautiful period features.

Situated between the iconic Clifton Triangle and the great shops down in Cabot Circus, there’s no better place to be based when exploring Bristol.

Other things to note
The Three Kings Court is a very tight-knit community, so we care a lot about keeping our neighbours happy! We ask that you do not host any sort of parties or gatherings at our flat, so as not to disturb them during your stay :)

description:
Private room with small double bed in a clean house - sharing with one couple. The bed is really comfortable and you have a garden view! Note, the bathroom is a shared wet room, we ask you to mop after use :)

St George is a key up and coming area in Bristol - an 8 minute walk from the great St George's Park and 10 minutes from Church Road for great coffee and pubs/restaurants. You can walk into Bristol city centre in 45 minutes or buses are regular and less than a minute's walk from our home.

The space
The bedroom is roomy, with a rocking chair and a lovely garden view. It's a basic room but you'll sleep well in a quiet area and no traffic noise :-)

The bathroom is a shared wet room with a powerful shower. We keep it clean and as it's a wet room just ask that you give it a quick mop after using :-)

Please do note we are a vegan house so we do not have meat or dairy. We ask you to kindly respect this, thank you so much 🌞

description:
Our four bedroom home, with a huge open-plan kitchen opening on to the garden, is in East Bristol. What we love about our house is that you are surrounded by green space and big skies but also close to the heart of Bristol and can easily access the South-West. From here you can walk in beautiful nature and to the independent cafes /shops of Easton. You are only two miles from the city centre - on bike via a cycle path or by bus or car, which you can park for free outside the house.

The space
Our home is set up for families. We have everything from the practical things like blackout blinds to fun stuff like toys - making it a super easy place to be with kids. It is also great space to cook and share meals, both indoors and out. The kitchen is well equipped and you can easily seat 12 around the large dining table. description:
One bedroom with double bed available, with a live-in-landlord and easygoing and respectful tenant. The house is only a 5 minute walk to Cabot Circus the main shopping centre in Bristol, so is incredibly central. It is a beautiful and homely fully equipped including sky TV and super fast sky WiFi, an air fryer and a Nespresso coffee machine. The room is quiet with a beautiful view and lets in the light.

There is complimentary kettle, tea, coffee and water and we have a guest only bathroom.

The space
Bedroom - Double bed with all bedding provided, comfy, luxurious mattress, large under bed storage, large desk, hanging space (hangers can be provided) and shelved storage

Lounge - 3 person sofa with large flatscreen and sky TV

The bedroom is a bright, large double with desk, TV and sofa bed, & coffee/tea facilities.

Gorgeous Victorian townhouse in sought after area (Bishopston): 2 mins stroll from the Cricket Ground; 3 minute walk from funky cafes & eclectic shops on Gloucester Road (UK’s longest street of independent shops). The City is 20 minutes walk or a short bus ride.

Spacious and full of plants, books and paintings, our home has a large kitchen/diner and sunny living room. We have a small but flowery garden and two friendly bunnies - Malcolm and Mabel - who have the run of the garden during the day.

The space
You will have the run of the whole house and we hope that you will love it just as much as we do. Do feel free to relax, enjoy the books and DVDs, potter in the garden and generally make yourselves at home.

description:
Our flat is on a peaceful, tree-lined residential street in the heart of Redland, footsteps away from all the area has to offer. It's only a short 12 min walk to the bustle of Whiteladies Road, or Gloucester Road in the other direction. Just 8 min to Chandos Road, Cotham Gardens, or the Redland Railway Station... perfect for getting around Bristol, or venturing out of town. At the top of our road is the lovely Redland Green, and the Downs, Bristol's favourite green space, is just a 15 min walk

The space
The flat is extremely spacious for a 1 bedroom, with a huge bay window with a desk to work in the bedroom, and a sofa bed in the lounge. It has huge, bright windows, high ceilings, and a lovely view of the front garden, as well as the Redland Court Manor House across the road. The kitchen is fully furnished, with everything you should need to feel at home, and a comfortable bed to rest at night. The space is extremely peaceful and perfect for a relaxing stay

description:
Bellevue Crescent is home to this beautiful, well positioned, furnished studio apartment.
One of the City's most popular neighbourhoods, Clifton Wood is wonderfully tranquil, given its central location, with fabulous views of the Harbourside, SS Great Britain and countryside beyond.
10mins walk from the city centre & a short ferry ride from Bristol Temple Meads Station, the apartment is set in a neat crescent of town houses - some paint their homes in bright colours, adding to the character.

The space
We use recycled or sustainable materials where at all possible. So our apartment is furnished with beautiful vintage items we have found during our own travels: for instance Victorian french windows as sliding doors, fruit boxes for storage and reclaimed floor boards from Bristol’s Colston Hall as kitchen shelves. This makes an eclectic, quirky and comfortable space, which we hope will help you feel at home.

description:
Our modern and spacious 2 bedroom flat is the perfect place to stay for your trip to Bristol! Only a short walk from the Bristol Harbourside, plenty of restaurants and shops are easily within reach.

The space
The flat has a private driveway which you are welcome to use during your stay, plus a space for a second car if necessary. Light and comfortable, the flat is complete with a fully fitted kitchen with all utensils provided, and a dining table which seats 4 guests for cosy nights in!
I have lived in locally my whole life and have seen Southville blossom into one of the most desired areas in Bristol. I’ll be letting my home while I take some time to explore Europe and then the world (hence the feature wall). I would love for you to enjoy my home and explore some of the many charms, both on North Street and the nearby Wapping Wharf.

description:
Welcome to Bath Buildings! Set in the heart of colourful Montpelier minutes away from Gloucester Road/Stokes Croft & the City centre. A spacious double room with new en-suite. The room has been redecorated as part of a refurbishment project to bring the 1800s property a new lease of life. Back in the day ‘Bath Buildings’ surrounded a famous public Bath which was just outside of the city boundary, making it the hotspot for raucous parties and boho crowds. Not much has changed…!

The space
Here you’ll have access to a spacious double bedroom and en-suite bathroom. There are 2 large sach windows overlooking Montpelier, a dressing table and chaise longue.

Guest access
Like a boutique hotel, you’ll come through a hallway/staircase to your room. The room has a kettle, mugs etc for teas/coffees.

Other things to note
For security reasons no additional guests are allowed without permission from the host.

description:
Come and enjoy a home from home in the heart of Southville (BS3). This beautiful home, decorated with attention to detail, showcases beautiful artwork from Bristol and beyond.

Southville is a bustling place, with cafes, bars, and restaurants. The house is a short walk to the centre (15 min) along the docks, with ready access to the countryside (10 min walk to Ashton Court).

The house is fully equipped (linen, towels, kitchenware) to allow you to enjoy your break, stress free.

Guest access
The house is yours (one room is locked to allow for storage).

Other things to note
This is a family friendly part of town, with lots of young couples and families. All the neighbours are friendly and people often say hello on the street. This is the norm for Lime Road!

5 bedroom house with off street parking sleeping up to 12 guests in Bristol

The space
 This 5-bedroom property is spread out over 3 floors and is great for all occasions. 

There are 5 bedrooms which sleep 9 guests, but this can be changed to 12 guests upon request. You will have use of a lounge, dining area, kitchen, 2 bathrooms and garden throughout your stay. There is also space for 2 cars to be parked out the back of the property and then lots of unrestricted parking out the front of the property. 

All communal space is located on the ground floor. On the first floor you will find 3 bedrooms. 2 double bedrooms and 1 single bedroom and 1 bathroom with a bath and shower over the bath.

description:
Unique hay barn conversion from 1900s, located just off Stokes Croft and Glouster Road and five minutes walk from central Bristol.

This property, known as the narrowest house in Bristol, is a cosy romantic base launch pad for a weekend in Bristol. Parking is available around the corner, along with a wealth of bars, pubs, art galleries, night clubs and shops.

Located on a quiet street, this isn't the place for a party - instead, it's perfectly suited for a weekend getaway.

The space
This is a narrow house! 2.1 meters wide! It's a beautifully converted hay barn and has all the character and charm you would expect to go with that.

Double height on the top floor and with a rustic kitchen and bathroom downstairs.

Guest access
Parking is around the corner, off the road, and behind a gate. I'll send through instructions after you've booked. Space for one regular car.

description:
Enjoy easy access to everything from this perfectly located, home base.
We are about 10 minutes drive (25 minutes walk) from Bristol city centre, near great bus routes. Parking is also easy on the road, which is in a quiet backwater. The house is perched on top of a hill in Bristol. In fact, just around the corner is the steepest inhabited hill in the UK, recently host to one of Banksy’s latest works, “Aachoo!”. You are guaranteed a warm stay with myself, my son and a small, friendly hound.

Fantastic self contained loft apartment

Whether for work or pleasure, if you want a little haven of peace and tranquillity, with easy access to nature, culture and the hustle and bustle of Bristol, just off the Downs, you will be welcome at “Downs View Loft”.

description:
A stylish, well located first floor 1 bedroom Georgian flat in the heart of Clifton.

A short walk from the centre of Clifton Village and the Clifton Suspension Bridge along with other various local amenities and attractions.

With many original features and also recently refurbished, the flat is packed with charm and character for a memorable stay.

The space
The flat comprises of a large, open plan living/dining/kitchen space with high ceilings, an original fireplace (non-functional) and cast iron radiators.

The space includes everything you need, including a dining table, TV, oven, coffee machine, ceramic hob, dishwasher, fridge/freezer & washer/dryer.

The bathroom includes a traditional brass overhead shower and heated towel rail. The bedroom hosts a comfortable double bed and wardrobe space.

Private balcony and bathroom for top room, office/bedroom (also with great views), gardens, new open living room.

We absolutely love our house. It's a modernised 60s terraced house in a very quiet, friendly, green cul de sac in a brilliant part of central Bristol. It's the perfect mix of quiet and secluded, and central and easy to access to anywhere in town. I've renovated most of the house, with brand new kitchen and bathrooms, and have opened it up so that almost anywhere you are in the house, you can appreciate one of the best views in Bristol.

2 floors. 1 master bedroom with en suite. 1 other bedroom with sofa bed. 1 bathroom (with bath & shower). 1 living room. 1 kitchen which leads onto balcony

description:
A private room with a private bathroom in a lovely flat on a quiet residential street in Totterdown with free on-street parking.

Walking distance to Bristol Temple Meads, Printworks, Victoria Park and Wapping Wharf. The street is just off Wells Road, meaning that you can get frequent, direct buses into the city centre, Clifton, Cribbs Causeway.

There are a number of lovely cafes and restaurants close by, so I can recommend the perfect place for dinner or breakfast during your stay.

The space
The spacious, light bedroom has a double bed, bedside table, chest of drawers, chair and large wardrobe.

The private bathroom has a lovely bath, large sink and toilet facilities. Eco-friendly shampoo, conditioner, body wash and soap is provided for guests.

Towels and bedding is provided, along with a hairdryer.

I can move a desk in there during your stay if you need a home working space, please request this when booki

description:
Spacious, comfortable light first floor master bedroom with king size bed. Work desk, chests of drawers and view of the rear garden with shared bathroom with bath & shower. Includes use of fibre WIFI, living room, kitchen/diner, utility room and garden.

Long stay welcome.

Welcome to our spacious period and family house in the heart of Redland, in a quiet and lovely street, within a few minutes walk to the vibrant Gloucester Road and Whiteladies Road, with direct transport links to the city.

Other things to note
I am an energetic healer and my practice is in the house. I live with my 4 kids ( 4, 6, 12 and 15 years old).

description:
Light and peaceful first floor of one of the oldest houses in Montpelier. The house is set on a residential road up a hill, just a couple of minutes from the bars and cafes of Stokes Croft. There are lots of nice cafes, shops and pubs nearby and it's an easy walk or bus ride into the city centre.

The space
The whole of the first floor is yours during your stay. The rooms are airy and characterful with wooden floorboards, rugs, sash windows and original fireplaces. There's a spacious bedroom with desk and a window overlooking the garden. A cosy living room with big comfy sofa and a woodburning stove. A small kitchen with everything you need to cook and a small bathroom with shower and mini-bath. Please note that I live downstairs and you share a front door and entry hall with me but the first floor is for your sole use.

Guest access
The house is a 25-30 minute walk from the city centre and harbourfront.

This is a spacious private room with an en-suite bathroom with rainforest shower, sofa, work station and impressive views of the clifton suspension bridge and Bristol city. The highlight is the beautiful sunrises and sunsets across bristol, that can be seen from the enormous window, and watch out on a clear day you’re likely to spot a balloon or two!

Guest access
Parking is available on the road for £6 per day and spaces are readily available (note please do not park directly in front of the house, but in the bays opposite). Access to the room is via a shared hallway.

Other things to note
We have a cat which will not be able to access the space, but may be in the communal corridor at times, if you are severely allergic or afraid of animals please let us know. Also she is an indoor cat

description:
A perfectly compact tiny home nestled into a beautiful Victorian area of Bristol. This lovingly converted old workshop is full of charm and unique features, made from bespoke reclaimed timber with rustic detailing.
The property has been designed to give a surprisingly spacious and cosy feel, with thermostatic central heating, and also boasts its own west facing private outdoor decking area.

The space
The kitchen has everything you need including an oven, 4 ring hob, fridge freezer and large sink. The bathroom is spacious in relation to the size of the space with lots of storage, an electric shower, sink and toilet. The lounge area has a TV and double sofa and more storage for clothing and bags. The sleeping area is up steep steps to a double bed. 2 Velux windows and a large porthole bring in lots of natural light to the interior space.

Guest access
Plenty of free parking on the street in the day time, getting busier from 5.00pm

description:
Welcome to Bristol!

Located on an exceptionally quiet traffic-free street, this enormous and stylish apartment is situated just 10 minutes walk from the station and 2 minutes walk from Bristol's premium city centre shopping mall.

A perfect place from which to explore this historic city, it's ideally situated for a short city break but would also be perfect for someone on business in Bristol who may want to stay longer.

The apartment has everything you need to make this a real home-from-home.

The space

Have fun with the whole family at this stylish, historical* town house in the heart of Clifton. (* one of few to have survived the Bristol Blitz.)

In addition to history beauty and stye it has super high speed 1GB Wifi.

There are many local attractions to visit in Bristol Including the Bristol Zoo which is near by or the M Shed Museum in the centre of town.

The space
The house is arranged on 4 floors: At road level, there is a lounge area with a workstation, TV and sleepable futon sofa. There is a utility room: Good for washing the dog, storing a bike or doing laundry. One flight up the the kitchen and main lounge, opening onto the raised pavement with a pair of antique benches to sit out on. The first floor has the master bedroom and bathroom, and the top is two further bedrooms.

description:
A comfortable double room with a queen-sized bed and desk-space set within a large Victorian terrace house with period features and stylish living areas.

The location is 6-8 mins to North St with its extensive street art and independent shops and cafes, 16 mins to Wapping Wharf/ Harbourside and 25 walk to Temple Meads Station or 5 mins to Bedminster Station.

You will have full access to all other shared living space; kitchen, 2 bathrooms, 2 reception rooms and the garden. Linen and towels.

description:
Set out of the hustle and bustle of Bristol City Centre Henbury House is perfect base for exploring the Bristol. Easy access to the M5/M4, The Wave, Avonmouth and Cribbs Causeway. Just 15 minutes drive from Clifton.

Three spacious double rooms - two with king-sized beds and third can be king-size or twin. Kitchen with a breakfast bar, full sized fridge freezer and dishwasher. Open plan living lounge diner for relaxing in after exploring Bristol.

The space
Fully equipped kitchen with gas hob, fridge freezer, microwave and breakfast bar to enjoy your morning tea or coffee - coffee machine included. An open space lounge diner hosts a comfy sofas, a 42" TV and a large dining table for up to six.

Upstairs, you'll find three spacious double bedrooms and a bright family bathroom with separate shower and bath. Two bedrooms are king-sized beds, and the third has the option for being king-size or a twin room, whichever best suits your needs.

description:
My apartment is quite unusual but full of charm. It is located on the top floor of a tenement house, so the view is great. A quiet bedroom on the side of the garden gives a sense of silence and in the morning the singing of birds wakes you from sleep. If you are looking for a romantic apartment for you and your other half, this is my apartment.

The space
In the bedroom you have a large double bed, soft sheets and a mattress. You will find a clothes hanger as well as a lamp and a bedside table. The bathroom is small, but the bathtub is huge. In the hall you will find a comfortable couch armchair and a lamp if you want to read. A large table and chairs by the window is a great breakfast for two or a romantic dinner by candles. The kitchen is perfectly equipped.

description:
Welcome to my stylish, modern studio flat in central Bristol! Fully furnished and complete with a private balcony, the property is a perfect spot for your trip to the city. Hundreds of shops, restaurants and bars are within walking distance, and a comfortable king sized bed welcomes you at the end of a day of exploring. No matter the purpose of your visit, we’d love to host you soon!

The space
The space is equipped with a large, comfortable king-sized bed - all bedding is provided and hotel quality linens await you to ensure a good night's sleep. The studio flat has a fully-equipped kitchen, bathroom with shower over bath and a dining area both inside and outside so that you can enjoy a home-cooked meal in the flat whatever the weather!

description:
*BRAND NEW LISTING* Stunning 1 bedroom apartment in the fantastic location of St George. Just a short walk from St George's Park, this apartment is an ideal base from which to visit one of Bristol's most vibrant and energetic communities, and to enjoy some of the best of local green space.

The space
The flat features an airy, open plan living space/kitchen, with high ceiling and a wood burner, combining with the bedroom area by means of a mezzanine. The kitchen is fully equipped with oven, hob, fridge, microwave and basic cookware. Put your feet up in our cosy living space, with a comfy sofa, apple tv and a wood burner for the winter. description: Luxuriate in the very heart of Bristol by staying in this brand new, uber stylish and comfortable private apartment. Situated in a lovingly restored Victorian ‘Gentleman’s Residence’ on a quiet residential road, simply step outside and all of Bristol beckons. Maybe wander across to the Clifton Ivy for lunch, browse shops such as Mint Velvet and other high-end boutiques in the beautiful Victorian Clifton Arcade. Then walk a couple of minutes to Clifton Suspension Bridge and have a drink at the Hotel Du Vin terrace with the best views in Bristol. Our apartment is situated in the sought-after area of Redland, a fantastic area to be based for visiting all that Bristol has to offer. We are within walking distance to the famous Gloucester Road with its iconic independent shops, bars and restaurants. Equally we are just as close to upmarket Whiteladies Road, with its chic Clifton appeal. These are the places to be for evening dinner, drinks with friends or just a casual lunch or brunch.

This lovely park-view flat has everything you need for a tranquil stay, close to the heart of Bristol and situated in trendy St George.

There is a big en-suite double bedrooom and also a small double. The 2nd bathroom has a bath.

Transport links are excellent, 10 mins drive from the M4, 10 mins bus journey into Briz, a 10 minute Uber from Temple Meads.

Several hangers are provided to hang items on the door.

description:
This unique and quirky double bedroom loft apartment is situated on the top floor of a secluded coach house, tucked away in the heart of Montpelier/St Pauls, a bohemian & vibrant area in Bristol.

It’s an ideal position just a short walk to the Center, Gloucester Rd, Stokes Croft, and Easton. Great for a short break with friends & family , or if you're in town working.

Easy links to Bristol Temple Meads train station, Bristol Coach Station, local
buses and the M32, M4 & M5 motors ways.

The space
You’re welcomed with lovely views up into Montpelier, a large open plan living/kitchen/dinner, with a pullout double sofa bed, dinning table and an independent work space.

The bedroom and the bathroom are both at the rear of the property. This spacious apartment has plenty of room for up to 4 people.

description:

Hopewell proudly welcomes our new block of luxurious apartments at Clifton 32, with this particular garden flat showing off a hot tub!
Guests have complete access to the garden flat and the hot tup will be ready for you to enjoy when you get there. Why not treat yourself to a nice glass of bubbly to really make the most of your stay.

description:
In the heart of Redland, 10 minutes walk from Whiteladies Rd and The Downs this residential house is hosted by Kaz and Steve. It offers a lovely large room with a superking bed (can be converted to twin beds). Self-service breakfast (cereal etc) available. There is a gorgeous garden out back and guests are welcome to enjoy the decked patio area overlooking Redland Green. There is parking available for one car on the driveway. Pixie, our small non-shedding Shorkie, will also make you welcome.

The space
The room has a superking, super comfy bed and writing desk. Guests will have sole use of the private bathroom which is immediately adjacent to the room. There are tea and coffee making facilities in the room.

Guest access
Guests are welcome to chill in the superb kitchen/snug area and enjoy the lovely garden overlooking Redland Green.

description:
Welcome to our gorgeous home in a quiet residential neighbourhood, fully-furnished and complete with private patio garden. The house is a spacious family home, but please note that is not suitable for parties - we ask that our guests respect the neighbours. We have a lovely master bedroom with a king-sized double bed, a spacious and light loft bedroom with en-suite, as well as another large double bedroom. This house was previously our home so, please no loud music or smoking on the premises.

The space
The house is spacious and well-equipped, and would be suitable for up to 7 guests: we have a lovely master bedroom with a king-sized double bed, a spacious and light loft bedroom with en-suite, as well as another large double bedroom - all with plenty of storage space for your items. The house is situated in a quiet family neighbourhood and therefore we ask please, no loud music or smoking on the premises.

description:
THIS PROPERTY CAN ONLY ACCOMMODATE STUDENTS! DO NOT BOOK IF YOU ARE NOT A STUDENT AND CANNOT PROVIDE A STUDENT ID OR YOUR RESERVATION WILL BE CANCELED.

Never miss the chance to get the full city centre experience in this welcoming accommodation, where you'll be right in the heart of the city, with live music, restaurants and shopping right on your doorstep.

This is an ideal location for students studying at the University of Bristol as it is very close to the accommodation, even the central bus station is across the road.

Choose from a range of en-suite room in cluster flats or studios.

If you are planning to stay with us, you will have the best student experience because of the location and lively environment it offers.


PLEASE NOTE THAT THERE IS NO AIR CONDITIONING AVAILABLE IN THE ROOM.

description:
Spacious, light and airy victorian flat with high ceilings close to the pubs and restaurants of the Whiteladies and Gloucester Roads. The popular Downs is just a 5 minute walk away. Cabot Circus and the Harbourside is a 2 mile walk or a short and frequent bus ride away. A perfect place to explore Bristol and the West Country. Off street parking, a large enclosed garden and two bathrooms. The flat provides all your home comforts with strong internet connection throughout.

The space
A lovely spacious airy apartment with high ceilings and all the home comforts you would expect

Guest access
You’ll have full and private access to the entire apartment and enclosed garden.

Other things to note
The garden apartment sits below another apartment where footfall can sometimes be heard.

Located close to the city centre, this is the perfect student accommodation in Bristol for you if you love to live amidst the buzzing city environment. description:
Your Bristol home from home is situated in historic Cotham on a quiet, leafy side street yet only minutes away from the hubbub of Stokes Croft and the Gloucester Road with their independent shops, cafés and bars, not forgetting all the street art, including several Banksy pieces.

The space
The house has an architect designed interior, which fuses the traditional with the contemporary and it has been decorated and furnished to a high standard by its interior designer owner.
It has 3/4 bedrooms and will comfortably sleep 8 people. There are 2 bathrooms, one of which is an en suite.
The sofa bed is in the rear reception room which is used by us as a home office/music room/spare bedroom. The main living room is separate. The spacious kitchen/diner looks out over the garden and is a contemporary addition to our early Victorian property.
The sunny gardens are a delight all year round and are also yours to enjoy during your stay.

description:
A unique place to stay in an Art and Crafts style cottage located in Bristol. There are excellent and fast links to Clifton, Whiteladies Rd and Bristol University (10 mins by train) or city centre by bus/train (takes 20 mins).
Off road parking is available. Guests are welcome to use the small galley kitchen. There's a little spare living room available for guests for somewhere to relax, and there's a garden.
It's a quiet and peaceful area of Bristol. Absolutely no smoking on the property.

The space
Designed by the architect George Oatley who planned Wills Memorial building at Bristol University, the cottage is part of a group of local dwellings for workers at Kings Weston House and was built in the Arts and Crafts style. The house has lots of the original features and the layout of the house is the same as when it was built in about 1910. The quiet and cosy guest room has a comfortable bed and a desk.

With a private garden and Victoria Park just moments away, you will find plenty of outdoor space to make the most of sunny weather.

There are also excellent transport links, with Bedminster train station around the corner. The airport flyer bus also stops a few minutes away on nearby East Street.

Other things to note
This is a lived in home containing the owner’s belongings, however you will have sole use of the flat and garden during your stay.

description:
Sunny room in vibrant area of Southville, Bristol. Five minutes to North Street theatres, restaurants, galleries, Ashton Court. Ten minute walk to airport bus route. Twenty minute walk into city centre, nearby bus stops. Free parking evenings and Sundays and close by free parking during daytime .. Spacious, airy with wooden floorboards.. My place is good for solo adventurers, business travelers and exploring Bristol.

The space
The house, in a Victorian terrace, was rebuilt as one of 5 around 1949.

description:
My peaceful & cosy terraced house is extremely well situated in the heart of Southville. Along with its two bedrooms, two bathrooms & cosy living room the house includes everything that I hope will make your stay as comfortable and relaxing as possible. The flat is full of character provided by original Victorian features, a clean contemporary new kitchen and an eclectic mix of furniture, artwork & decoration.

The flat is in a great location to explore nearby areas of Cotham Hill and Chandos Road, as well as Clifton & the City Centre.

The space
Located on the first floor of a Victorian terrace house, the large south-west facing open-plan kitchen, living & dining room benefits from sunlight throughout the day and is a wonderful space to relax in.

The spacious double bedroom is located at the rear of the flat, looking onto leafy neighbouring gardens.

Period features have been maintained throughout the flat, with traditional fireplaces, ceiling roses, cornicing and sash windows.

Guest access
The flat is accessed off a shared hall

description:
Our beautiful maisonette is placed in the heart of Clifton Village, Bristol's prettiest neighbourhood filled with cobbled lanes and sweeping Georgian terraces. We are surrounded by award-winning restaurants and independent boutiques, and just a stone’s throw from Bristol’s iconic Suspension Bridge. The apartment boasts an open-plan lounge and dining area, well-equipped kitchen and a large bedroom with an en-suite bathroom, accessed via a spiral staircase.

The space
We have furnished this cosy oasis with everything you’ll need for a comfortable and restful stay. Our luxurious king sized bed and black out curtains will ensure a peaceful night’s sleep, and our state-of-the-art coffee machine will set you up for the day! In the spacious lounge you will find a large sofa and television, with a dining table and chairs for two on the left. The kitchen is well stocked with cooking equipment and crockery, a toaster, oven and hob, as well as a brand new dishwasher. Upstair

description:
You're viewing for an entire house. Centrally located in Stokes Croft, Bristol. Ideally located for visiting Bristol and easy access to Bath.

This unique upside down house has an amazing view and light, consists of 2 separate bedrooms, 1 bathroom and an open plan kitchen lounge which is perfect for a cosy nights in.

Towels and bed line are included in this accommodation.

This is our 2nd listing we're brining to Airbnb, we are experienced super hosts with an A-plus rated listing.

The space
an upside down house with the lounge and kitchen on the top floor giving beautiful light and views.

description: We welcome you to stay in our stylish top-floor condo, in Southville’s Old Fire Station development. Your view includes the iconic colourful harbourside houses, lots of gorgeous greenspace, and even a glimpse of the suspension bridge. Inside, our space is chic and peaceful. Our treasured plants and artsy furnishings await you in our clean and calm space. Located just off North Street and a short walk away from the harbour/centre, you’ll have everything you need for an amazing Bristol stay.
